Learn Python

Pandas

Pandas is a module in Python for working with data structures. The main object from Pandas is the DataFrame which organizes data into a column structure with row and column labels. This object can easily subset, aggregate and reshape the data using the array-computing features of NumPy.

Import Pandas

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

Creating a DataFrame

height = [5.6, 7.0, 4.9, 6.7, 5.2, 5.5, 6.1]
names = ['Holly', 'Bart', 'Josh', 'Karen', 'Tom', 'Doug', 'Sophie', 'Joe']
c1.height
over5.5 = c1.height[c1.height >=5.5]

To import data from a tab-delimited file, 

data = pd.read_csv('myfile.txt', delimiter='\t', names=headernames).dropna()
print "Number of rows: %i" % data.shape[0]
data.head()  # print the first 5 rows
